info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 19 at 8:26AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A LINE OF HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS WILL AFFECT NORTHERN JEFFERSON... SOUTHEASTERN COLUMBIANA...NORTHEASTERN CARROLL...BEAVER... NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON...SOUTHERN LAWRENCE...BUTLER...NORTHERN ALLEGHENY...NORTHWESTERN WESTMORELAND...WEST CENTRAL ARMSTRONG... SOUTHWESTERN CLARION AND HANCOCK COUNTIES... At 825 AM EST, a line of heavy snow showers was located along a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Shanor-Northvue to Evans City to 6 miles west of Toronto. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. Winds in excess of 30 mph are possible with this area of heavy snow. Locations impacted include... Ross Township, McCandless Township, Cranberry, Moon Township, Weirton, Steubenville, Butler, Franklin Park, East Liverpool, Aliquippa, Beaver Falls, and Monaca. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 3 and 47. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 64 and 107. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 31 and 56. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
